@notice this view returns the address that can exempt depositors from deposit limits
 @return the address can exempt depositors from deposit limits
@return current multisig_control_address

@param asset_source Contract address for given ERC20 token
 @return The assigned Vega Asset ID for given ERC20 token

@param vega_asset_id Vega-assigned asset ID for which you want the ERC20 token address
 @return The ERC20 token contract address for a given Vega Asset ID

@notice this view returns the address that can exempt depositors from deposit limits
 @return the address can exempt depositors from deposit limits
@return current multisig_control_address

@param asset_source Contract address for given ERC20 token
 @return The assigned Vega Asset ID for given ERC20 token

@param vega_asset_id Vega-assigned asset ID for which you want the ERC20 token address
 @return The ERC20 token contract address for a given Vega Asset ID

deposit_asset(address,uint256,bytes32).details: MUST emit Asset_Deposited if successfulERC20 approve function should be run before running this

params.amount: Amount of tokens to be deposited into Vega
params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.vega_public_key: Target Vega public key to be credited with this deposit

params.depositor: The depositor to exempt from limits

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token

returns._0: Lifetime limit for the given asset

params.vega_asset_id: Vega-assigned asset ID for which you want the ERC20 token address

returns._0: Maximum valid deposit of given ERC20 token

returns._0: Minimum valid deposit of given ERC20 token

params.lister: The address that can exempt depositors

params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.lifetime_limit: Deposit limit for a given ethereum address
params.nonce: Vega-assigned single-use number that provides replay attack protection
params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order

params.nonce: Vega-assigned single-use number that provides replay attack protection
params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order

params.nonce: Vega-assigned single-use number that provides replay attack protection
params.signatures: Vega-supplied signature bundle of a validator-signed order
params.threshold: Withdraw size above which the withdraw delay goes into effect

params.asset_source: Contract address for given ERC20 token
params.creation: Timestamp of when requestion was created *RESTRICTION FEATURE*

deposit_asset(address,uint256,bytes32).notice: This function allows a user to deposit given ERC20 tokens into VegaERC20 approve function should be run before running this

exempt_depositor(address).notice: this function allows the exemption_lister to exempt a depositor from the deposit limitsthis feature is specifically for liquidity and rewards providers

get_asset_deposit_limit(address).notice: This view returns the lifetime deposit limit for the given asset

get_deposit_maximum(address).notice: This view returns maximum valid deposit

get_deposit_minimum(address).notice: This view returns minimum valid deposit

get_exemption_lister().notice: this view returns the address that can exempt depositors from deposit limits

get_withdraw_threshold(address).notice: This view returns the given token's withdraw threshold above which the withdraw delay goes into effect

global_resume(uint256,bytes).notice: This function resumes bridge operations from the stopped state

global_stop(uint256,bytes).notice: This function triggers the global bridge stop that halts all withdrawals and deposits until it is resumed

is_asset_listed(address).notice: This view returns true if the given ERC20 token contract has been listed valid for deposit

is_exempt_depositor(address).notice: this view returns true if the given despoitor address has been exempted from deposit limits

list_asset(address,bytes32,uint256,uint2.notice: This function lists the given ERC20 token contract as valid for deposit to this bridgeSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

remove_asset(address,uint256,bytes).notice: This function removes from listing the given ERC20 token contract. This marks the token as invalid for deposit to this bridgeSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

revoke_exempt_depositor(address).notice: this function allows the exemption_lister to revoke a depositor's exemption from deposit limitsthis feature is specifically for liquidity and rewards providers

set_deposit_maximum(address,uint256,uint.notice: This function sets the maximum allowable deposit for the given ERC20 tokenSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

set_deposit_minimum(address,uint256,uint.notice: This function sets the minimum allowable deposit for the given ERC20 tokenSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

set_exemption_lister(address,uint256,byt.notice: this function allows MultisigControl to set the address that can exempt depositors from the deposit limitsthis feature is specifically for liquidity and rewards providers

set_lifetime_deposit_max(address,uint256.notice: This function sets the lifetime maximum deposit for a given asset

set_withdraw_delay(uint256,uint256,bytes.notice: This function sets the withdraw delay for withdrawals over the per-asset set thresholds

set_withdraw_threshold(address,uint256,u.notice: This function sets the withdraw threshold above which the withdraw delay goes into effect

withdraw_asset(address,uint256,address,u.notice: This function withdrawals assets to the target Ethereum addressSee MultisigControl for more about signatures

userdoc.notice: Implementations of this interface are used by Vega network users to deposit and withdraw ERC20 tokens to/from Vega.
